kiryu.name: Kazuma Kiryu
kiryu.explanation:
The former 4th chairman of the Tojo Clan, a yakuza organization in control of 
eastern Japan. Kiryu is a legend in the Japanese underworld, known throughout as
the Dragon of Dojima. He left the yakuza life behind to run the Morning Glory 
orphanage in Okinawa alongside Haruka Sawamura, the daughter of his late love, 
Yumi. However, his pursuit of a peaceful life was continuously disrupted by his 
yakuza days catching up to him. In 2012, he was a central figure in the 
nationwide conflict over who would be the next chairman of the Omi Alliance.

akiyama.name: Shun Akiyama
akiyama.explanation:
The man behind Sky Finance, a loan company in Kamurocho. Known as the "Lifeline
of Kamurocho," he presents those looking for money with a condition they must 
meet before he approves a loan. He met Kiryu through Saejima's stepsister, 
Yasuko. In 2012, he went to Sotenbori, Osaka to open a branch office and 
reunited with Haruka, who was in the entertainment industry at the time. He 
helped her when the president of her talent agency died under mysterious 
circumstances.

big.name: Big Lo
big.explanation:
The leader of the Saio Triad, who quickly rebuilt Little Asia after the huge 
fire and has made it his home base. His son Jimmy Lo was murdered while fighting
the Tojo Clan for control of Kamurocho. Lo seems to have some sort of deep 
connection with Onomichi, as he has been sending undocumented Chinese people, 
such as Masuzoe and Tatsukawa, into the Yomei Alliance for many years.

saejima.name: Taiga Saejima
saejima.explanation:
A legendary yakuza, Saejima spent 25 years in prison for murdering 18 enemy 
yakuza. After doing his time, he returned to the Tojo Clan intending to set up 
his own family. He decided he needed to cleanse himself of all past sins to 
accomplish this, voluntarily going back to prison. However, after hearing the 
rumors that Goro Majima had died, he was targeted by a conspiracy
orchestrated by the 7th chairman of the Omi Alliance. He decided to escape from 
prison and helped put a stop to the conflict, but in doing so, became a fugitive.

majima.name: Goro Majima
majima.explanation:
The unpredictably violent yakuza known as the Mad Dog of Shimano, once 
feared across the criminal underworld. Sworn brother of Taiga Saejima, he 
is a man of his own code who yearns to fight against those who claim to be
strong. Majima views himself as Kiryu's greatest rival, having battled him
countless times over the years. In 2012, there were rumors of his demise,
but in reality he was working with Daigo Dojima to end the yakuza conflict.

sugai.name: Katsumi Sugai
sugai.explanation:
A veteran member of the Tojo Clan relegated to an advisory role for years before
ascending to acting chairman. His rise to power was made possible by the arrest 
of key Tojo Clan figures, Daigo Dojima, Goro Majima, and Taiga Saejima. He has 
slowly brought the whole clan under his control in order to wage war against a 
Chinese mafia organization called the Saio Triad.

someya.name: Takumi Someya
someya.explanation:
A confidant of Sugai, the acting 6th chairman of the Tojo Clan. He used the 
conflict between the Tojo Clan and the Saio Triad to his advantage and rose to 
be a direct patriarch despite only being in his thirties.

edo.name: Ed
edo.explanation:
An officer of the Saio Triad who is one of the few to have the privilege of 
talking directly to their boss. Ed is an alias; his real name is unknown.
His weapon of choice is a Southeast Asian knife called a karambit. Ed is an 
intimidating, giant man who kills without hesitation.

jimy.name: Jimmy Lo
jimy.explanation:
The son of the leader of the Saio Triad and successor to the organization. He 
was found dead three months ago in Kamurocho. It's believed that he was murdered
by members of the Tojo Clan, which intensified the conflict in Kamurocho.

nagumo.name: Tsuyoshi Nagumo
nagumo.explanation:
The captain of the Hirose Family, a small subsidiary of the Masuzoe Family
within the Yomei Alliance that controls all of Hiroshima. Nagumo is a
small-town yakuza who's impulsive and outspoken. The run-down bar district
of Onomichi is his territory, but he never seems to get much done outside
of drinking all day.

yuta.name: Yuta Usami
yuta.explanation:
One of the five members of the Hirose Family. Even though Yuta was raised in 
Onomichi, he speaks with only a light Hiroshiman accent. He shows little
respect for Nagumo because of the captain's irresponsible nature. As a result, 
Yuta often talks back to Nagumo at the risk of getting smacked.

matsunga.name: Takaaki Matsunaga
matsunga.explanation:
A member of the Hirose Family who is next in rank after Nagumo. He is easygoing
and speaks with a plain Hiroshima accent.

hirose.name: Toru Hirose
hirose.explanation:
The elderly patriarch of the Hirose Family. Despite being a veteran yakuza,
he lives a retired lifestyle and earns cash from insurance fraud.
All of the duties of running the family are left completely to his captain,
Nagumo. It's rumored that, in his younger days, he fought on the front
lines in the conflict with the Omi Alliance, though no one knows whether
to believe that.

tagashira.name: Naoto Tagashira
tagashira.explanation:
One of the five Hirose Family members. Tagashira is far more knowledgeable
about the internet and social media than the others. Rather than Nagumo, he
looks up to the responsible Matsunaga to learn the ways of being a yakuza.
While he respects Matsunaga, he also secretly feels the need to look after
him, as Matsunaga is not the sharpest tool in the shed.

masuzoe.name: Koji Masuzoe
masuzoe.explanation:
The patriarch of the Masuzoe Family within the Yomei Alliance. He is known
to be a man of small caliber; oppressive toward the weak, and a coward
around those stronger than he is. He's especially harsh toward the
Hirose Family for not earning much.

koshimizu.name: Kanji Koshimizu
koshimizu.explanation:
The second most powerful yakuza in Hiroshima under Takeru Kurusu, the
chairman of the Yomei Alliance. He places utmost importance on Iwami
Shipbuilding, a top-class company that has turned Onomichi into a corporate
castle town. Because of that, he shows up to settle a score with the Hirose
Family for Matsunaga punching an Iwami Shipbuilding worker. He recognized
Kiryu with just one look, and as the captain of the Yomei Alliance, he doesn't
think much of the Tojo Clan.

kurusu.name: Takeru Kurusu
kurusu.explanation:
Founder and chairman of the mysterious Yomei Alliance which acts independentlyã€€
and stays distant from all other yakuza organizations in Japan. Although they 
are the third largest organization after the Omi Alliance and Tojo Clan, they 
have never failed to drive away invaders and their inner workings are shrouded 
in secrecy. Takeru Kurusu is his yakuza name; his public persona is Heizo Iwami,
chairman of Iwami Shipbuilding. Using those two identities, he controls all of
Hiroshima both publicly and from the shadows.

iwamit.name: Tsuneo Iwami
iwamit.explanation:
The CEO of Iwami Shipbuilding, inherited from his father, Heizo Iwami, who
founded the world-class company. As Heizo's son, the members of the Yomei
Alliance below Koshimizu bow down to him, and he often takes advantage of
that by throwing his weight around. He has the temperament of a cool-headed
businessman, also an inheritance from his father. Many businesses in Hiroshima
were started by Tsuneo, and it's said that there isn't a soul in Hiroshima not
associated with the Iwami Group in some fashion.

tatukawa.name: Shu Tatsukawa
tatukawa.explanation:
A former yakuza who left the Hirose Family six months ago and became a host
in Kamurocho. He is a young man around the same age as Yuta and Tagashira,
and he is rumored to be the father of Haruto.

date.name: Makoto Date
date.explanation:
Date has been an ally to Kiryu over the years ever since the Ten Billion Yen 
Incident of 2005, and there is a strong bond of trust between them. He had 
retired from detective work to chase political cases as a journalist, but he's 
returned to his position as a police officer. Younger officers respect him as a 
sophisticated, veteran detective. His relationship with the Mama of New Serena 
seems to be going well.

honjo.name: Jiro Honjo
honjo.explanation:
When Haruka was involved with the hit-and-run in Kamurocho, he was the first to
notify Date about the accident. He's an experienced detective and is 
knowledgeable about Kamurocho's underworld. However, he believes in upholding 
the law above all else, so he disapproves of Date and Kiryu's relationship, 
seeing it as collusion.

haruka.name: Haruka Sawamura
haruka.explanation:
The daughter of the late Yumi Sawamura, Kiryu's love. After the Ten Billion Yen 
Incident, she moved to Okinawa with Kiryu and began living with the children at 
the Morning Glory orphanage. She became an idol after being scouted by the Osaka
talent agency Dyna Chair, but the president of the firm, Mirei Park, died after 
getting caught up in a conflict between the yakuza. Afterwards, she publicly 
recognized Kiryu as her family while on stage at the Japan Dome and retired on 
the spot.

haruto.name: Haruto Sawamura
haruto.explanation:
Haruka's baby, who Haruka risked her own life to protect during the hit-and-run
in Kamurocho. He looks to be under a year old.

asagao.name: Children of Morning Glory
asagao.explanation:
The children of Morning Glory, an orphanage in Okinawa, who Kiryu takes care of.
The oldest is Ayako, followed by Taichi, Koji, Mitsuo, Eri, Shiro, Riona and 
Izumi. When Haruka became an idol, Kiryu left Morning Glory and tried to bury 
his past as a yakuza for Haruka's sake. He worked as a taxi driver for some time,
sending the money he made to the children.

jyungi.name: Joon-gi Han
jyungi.explanation:
The young leader of the Jingweon Mafia, a Korean mafia organization which Kiryu
destroyed in 2006. Now, the Jingweon Mafia has changed hands to the younger
generation, who no longer holds a grudge against Kiryu. They are in the 
process of expanding into Kamurocho's sex industry using their vast financial 
resources, exemplified by buying out Club Stardust.

daidouji.name: Minoru Daidoji
daidouji.explanation:
The man who became known as the Fixer for his political backroom dealings after
the end of World War II. As a former imperial navy officer, he ordered Iwami 
Shipbuilding to construct the Yamato Mk. II without government sanction. 
However, the war ended just before it was to be completed, and he covered up the
existence of the battleship for his own protection. When he later made a name 
for himself as a politician, he colluded with Takeru Kurusu in order to hide the
battleship, referred to as the secret of Onomichi. However, when the secret was 
revealed, he cut ties with Kurusu and ordered Kurusu's son, Tsuneo Iwami, to get
rid of Kiryu.

kasahara.name: Kiyomi Kasahara
kasahara.explanation:
Kiyomi runs a small bar in the run-down bar district of Onomichi. She welcomes 
Kiryu, who was taking care of baby Haruto, and tries to help him out in any way 
she can.

iino.name: Ino
iino.explanation:
The manager of the Navy Apartments who has connections to the Jingaicho 
neighborhood association. Ino is a childhood friend of Nagumo and Kiyomi<symbol=em_dash_with_outline>he and 
Nagumo are rivals for Kiyomi's affection. He runs an amateur baseball team that 
always struggles with a lack of members.

daigo.name: Daigo Dojima
daigo.explanation:
The 6th chairman of the Tojo Clan and only son of Dojima Family patriarch,
Sohei Dojima. Daigo tried to stay out of the yakuza lifestyle, but after the
death of the 5th chairman, Yukio Terada, Kiryu put the Tojo Clan in his hands.
During the 2012 Omi Alliance conflict, he worked hard to bring all yakuza
organizations across Japan together, leading the conflict to its conclusion.
